TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ManualWorkflowSchedulerService extends System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.WorkflowSchedulerService

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides a threading service that allows the host application creating a workflow instance to donate the on which the workflow instance is run. Using this threading service, host applications can run a workflow instance on a single in synchronous mode (although if the workflow contains a delay activity, the work is postponed until after the delay activity is executed on a separate thread spawned by [System.Threading.Timer](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)).This mode blocks the execution of the host application until the workflow instance becomes idle. Subsequently, the workflow instance can only be executed using the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ManualWorkflowSchedulerService.RunWorkflow%2A> method of this service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
ManualWorkflowSchedulerService does not automatically run a workflow instance that is in the queue. The host must call <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ManualWorkflowSchedulerService.RunWorkflow%2A> to run a specified workflow.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool useActiveTimers) cil managed

Docs.param: that determines how delay activities are handled. If , the scheduler service automatically resumes workflows after delay activities expire (by using an in-memory timer). If , the host must manually resume the workflow after the delay activities expire.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: A that contains parameters for `useActiveTimers`. If , the scheduler service automatically resumes workflows after delay activities expire (by using an in-memory timer). If , the host must manually resume the workflow after the delay activities expire.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Guid> associated with the existing scheduled work item to cancel.
Docs.summary: Cancels the specified existing workflow instance work item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnStarted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Overloaded from <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.WorkflowRuntimeService.OnStarted%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. This method is called whenever <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.StartRuntime%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is called and is used by the to do work that is needed when the starts.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RunWorkflow(valuetype System.Guid workflowInstanceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Guid> for the workflow instance to run.
Docs.returns: if the workflow starts running; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a synchronous call that uses the current thread to run the workflow. It does not return until the workflow idles, suspends, completes, terminates, or aborts.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void Schedule (System.Threading.WaitCallback callback, Guid workflowInstanceId);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void Schedule(class System.Threading.WaitCallback callback, valuetype System.Guid workflowInstanceId) cil managed

Docs.param: A multicast delegate that represents the method to run.
A <xref:System.Guid> that represents the workflow instance.
Docs.summary: Adds a workflow instance to the pending work items queue using the specified workflow instance using the specified multicast delegate.
Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

Docs.param: A multicast delegate that represents the method to run.
A <xref:System.Guid> that represents the workflow instance.
The <xref:System.DateTime> that indicates the time to begin running the thread.
A <xref:System.Guid> that represents the scheduled thread.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified workflow instance to the pending work item queue using the specified multicast delegate, <xref:System.DateTime> and GUIDs.
Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
